result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment as directed by DOC.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 2 years upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation of DOC.

timeConds.notes: 30 days STAYED. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Report date on remaining 30 day sentence to be worked out with probation agent/defendant/jail. Sentence needs to be served within the first year of probation. Huber release granted.
To perform 100 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua A Clark in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for setencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Joshua A Clark in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerber asks court to set a plea/sentencing date the end of September/beginning of October. Defendant recently had shoulder surgery, would like a little more time to heal before proceeding with a plea. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Joshua A Clark in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates matter is close to resolving, needs more time to meet with defendant. Atty Gerbers requests a plea/sentencing date in 30 days. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates his office left a voicemail for defendant yesterday, haven't heard from defendant since. Atty Gerbers indicates matter is close to resolving, asks that matter be set over for another date. State has no objection.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on July 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua A Clark in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense has not received discovery. State has not received discovery demand.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.

Defendant Joshua A Clark in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed within 10 days.

Defendant Joshua A Clark in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Defense requests a status in 45 days. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
